Store Extensibility

<xref:System.Activities.DurableInstancing.SqlWorkflowInstanceStore> allows users to promote custom, application-specific properties that can be used to query for instances in the persistence database.
The act of promoting a property causes the value to be available within a special view in the database.
These promoted properties (properties that can be used in user queries) can be of simple types such as Int64, Guid, String, and DateTime or of a serialized binary type (byte[]).

The <xref:System.Activities.DurableInstancing.SqlWorkflowInstanceStore> class has the <xref:System.Activities.DurableInstancing.SqlWorkflowInstanceStore.Promote%2A> method that you can use to promote a property as a property that can be used in queries.
The following example is an end-to-end example of store extensibility.
In this example scenario, a document processing (DP) application has workflows, each of which uses custom activities for document processing.
These workflows have a set of state variables that need to be made visible to the end user.
To achieve this, the DP application provides an instance extension of type <xref:System.Activities.Persistence.PersistenceParticipant>, which is used by activities to supply the state variables.
The new extension is then added to the host.
For more details about adding a custom persistence participant, see the [Persistence Participants](../../../docs/framework/windows-workflow-foundation/persistence-participants.md) sample.
The custom activities in the DP application populate various status fields in the **Execute** method.

When a workflow instance reaches a persistence point, the **CollectValues** method of the **DocumentStatusExtension** persistence participant saves these properties into the persistence data collection.
All these properties are passed to **SqlWorkflowInstanceStore** by the persistence framework through the **SaveWorkflowCommand.InstanceData** collection.
The DP application initializes the SQL Workflow Instance Store and invokes the **Promote** method to promote this data.
Based on this promotion information, **SqlWorkflowInstanceStore** places the data properties in the columns of the [InstancePromotedProperties](#InstancePromotedProperties) view.
To query a subset of the data from the promotion table, the DP application adds a customized view on top of the promotion view.
